STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 30, 2024
Brian E Millikin
MIDLAND/GLADWIN COUNTY DHHS
1509 WASHINGTON ST STE A, Suite A
MIDLAND, MI, 48640-5612
RE: License#: CP560201302
Dear Brian E Millikin:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 4/26/2024. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
Case Plan Development/ Reassessment
Initial Case Plan (ISP) – within 30 calendar days before the
case plan due date. Note: This FTM may be combined with
the CPS Case Opening (ISP) FTM. Updated Case Plan
(USP) – within 30 calendar days before the case plan due
date. Permanent Ward Service Plan (PWSP) – within 30
calendar days before the case plan due date.
One of eight current foster child records reviewed indicated an FTM was not
completed as required for the report time period ending 1/26/2024.
Repeat Violation Established:
2023 Interim CAP approved 9/28/2023.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD

There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows.
The agency had three areas of noncompliance as a result of the interim evaluation
completed 7/20/2023. The areas of noncompliance were Rules 327(6)(c), 327(7)
and FOM 722-06B. The CAP for this noncompliance was approved 9/28/2023.
The only area identified as a repeat noncompliance as a part of this renewal
evaluation was FOM 722-06B. There was only one incident identified in
noncompliance. It was reported in the exit conference, supervision is continuing to
work with a specific staff member regarding their performance in this area.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. It included a review of the two
areas of noncompliance identified in the previous review/evaluation and the
progress in establishing and maintaining compliance. A noted barrier was the
need to be more specific in communicating corrective actions. The agency is
performing well in addressing key performance indicators.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not indicate any areas of concern. Staff reported feeling supported by the
agency and this was reinforced by positive comments from the Chief Administrator
regarding the staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment, and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care and licensing services. All files were stored securely and
there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns. Comments from caregivers and youth
were positive and indicated appropriate support services are being provided.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
04/30/2024
_____________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
04/30/2024
